Reviews.Title: “What a 5 star hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: floraltouch
Reviews.Content: We travel to Dallas 2 times a year for market and have been doing so for 15 years,three years ago we found the Elegante. It was the best decision we could have made, they pick up up at the airport and will shuttle you almost anywhere, the free breakfast is great the happy hour free,usually the manager is there to greet you. but i think the main thing is the freindliness of all the staff they seem to be happy in their job, always the same staff

Reviews.Title: “great food, great value”
Reviews.Author: dedon4
Reviews.Content: the employees are outstanding, friendly and accommodating, the food is great! and the whole place goes out of their way to make yo feel at home. stay on the club floor if you can - physical plant is in great shape - the rest of the hotel is fine, little dated but new tils an paint - replacing floor from the top floors down great value for your $$ - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and value for your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: rvaillan
Reviews.Content: I don't know what those people are talking about but I recently have had 3 meetings at this location and it was wonderful. The staff bends over backwards to accomodate you. The food is excellent. Jeanie and Jenny are just fabulous to work with and will do what it takes to make you happy. One of the meetings involved 45 people and I received not one complaint from any of them. I was hesitatant at first as this was not a chain hotel and I was not sure what to expect. I have found a diamond in the rough. They will work within your budget and in this economy that matters. yes it's not a 5 star hotel but the rooms are clean well decorated. The beds are more comfortable than some of the pricey hotel I have stayed at. Also another big plus to this hotel is I had travelers flying in from two different airports and they have a shuttle that goes to both. That in itself is a rare find in Dallas. I will definetely be bringing back more meetings to this locations.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: Swannybill
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after reading more positive reviews than negative ones. The building has seen some wear and some things seemed a bit dated. A young man Oscar checked my wife and me in the hotel. He wasn't very friendly but we all have bad days. We got to our room and there were burns on the floor from an iron. It was hot and stuffy in the room and we turned on the air conditioner and it cooled off slowly for about an hour. I bet you can guess where this is going. About 12:45 in the morning I was sweating and tried to adjust the air conditioner to no avail. I called down to the office and no one would answer so I walked down to the front desk and spoke to Christopher. I explained the problem and with a bad attitude he set me up in a new room that was across the hall. I asked if it was ok to leave my stuff in the first room. Its 1 o'clock in the morning. I'm exhausted, he said we prefer you not do that. When I went back to the room with malfunctioning air conditioner my wife was too tired to get up. She can sleep in an 80 degree room. I moved to the new room and checked the air conditioner and when it cooled off I went to sleep. At 3 o'clock in the morning Christopher was at my door asking why I had not vacated the first room. I explained that my wife was asleep in that room. He gave me a dirty look and stated fine and walked off. At this point I was angry for the lack of professionalism and poor customer service. I woke my wife up and we packed our stuff and left the hotel. A very defensive Christopher at the from desk said you will probably want to talk to the manager as if he had been through that before. I called the manager a few hours later. I explained what happened and the front desk manager, who wouldn't tell me anything but his first name, Ricky. He was no help. No apology other than explaining that no hotel allows you to occupy two hotel rooms for the price of one. I wonder if they were planning to rent out the room at 3 o'clock in the morning. Composing my letter to corporate offices about the severe lack of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great HUGE room at regular room price....:))”
Reviews.Author: Divinit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had my sister-in-law meet us at this hotel as she flew in to Love Field. We stayed here and spent most of the evening down in the wonderful hotel bar, socializing and watching the Ranger game. Price was great, location so good we walked across the road to a nearby nightclub for dancing and walked back without any problems. AND we had a fully appointed breakfast in the restaurant the next morning as a part of the package. Can't be beat. If you can stay here, do....

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Trayci2684
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the MCM Elegante Hotel and Suites when we traveled to Dallas for the Red River Rivalry football game and a Rangers playoff game. As a result of the rivalry football game, the hotel was crowded and noisy (mostly from college kids traveling with their team and drinking a bit too much alcohol in the evenings). The hotel and the standard room we had were both average. They were clean, but a little dated. The bath products provided were from "Bath and Body Works" and were very nice. I enjoy taking a hot bath before bed each evening and typically don't have a problem with having enough hot water. The hot water at the MCM Elegante took a very long time to get hot, but it did eventually warm up (which is the most important part for me!). The bed was very comfortable and the hotel provided plenty of pillows, both soft and firm. The air conditioner unit was loud, but it did a good job keeping the room cool, which is an important thing in Dallas! Our room was directly across from the ice machine on our floor and it was amazing how much noise filtered through the walls into our room, both the noises of the ice machines and people talking. The location of the hotel is excellent for getting around in Dallas. There are lots of nice restaurants nearby (including Chili's, Pappadeaux, etc.) and there is a Starbucks across the street. Since the hotel is on the Northwest Highway, it was easy to visit all of the attractions that we wanted to see while in Dallas. There is also a DART station within a mile of the hotel, if you want to take public transportation. The breakfast provided by the hotel was one of the best that I have had. They provided hot items, like eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, biscuits, gravy and hash browns and they also provided cold items, like cereal and pastries. It was nice to have the variety and everything that I had was very good. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for an average trip to Dallas. If you are coming to Dallas for a special occasion, I would recommend looking at something a little more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Xpilot1
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately had the experience of staying at this hotel on a weekend. My room was very noisy and I was woken up many times by people talking in the halls all through the night. The hotel actually sold a block of rooms to a fraternity, then put me in the middle of them. To add insult to injury the TV didn't work and the toilet wouldn't flush. After several noise complaints I ask to change rooms and they told me they were sold out. I spend about 150 nights a year in hotels and this was the worst experience I have had this year. I won't recommend this hotel to anyone unless you want to be the one up drunk and partying all night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mwalts02
Reviews.Content: I loved the MCM hotel we stayed there for a Dallas Cowboys game that we went to and I defiantly will be staying there again. They have a shuttle to and from the stadium so you donâ€™t have to worry about parking or driving. Everybody that worked there was very accommodating and friendly especially in the lounge, not to mention the best bed you'll ever sleep on!!!! Go Cowboys!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: allizcat
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed 5 days at this hotel, and i cant think of anything bad to say. the room was great, the bed was very great, the breakfast buffet was great, the pool was beautiful, and the service was wonderful. it is located a block from restaurant row and has easy acces to highways and interstates. so location is great as well!! we cant wait to go back. this will be our hotel anytime we are in dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Great employees- great value!”
Reviews.Author: Trevman
Reviews.Content: All the desk reps are great, especially Arturo and Jackie. They both helped me with special arrangements I needed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Dan44535
Reviews.Content: Best Value, best beds and best people. From the free hot breakfast, to the great pool area, to outstanding sports bar, to the excellent beds, this hotel was perfect for me. After my two day stay I knew the names of several of the staff members, I could tell they were customer driven, because everything that a business traveler could want was at my finger tips. Free business center, great breakfast, great dining area, nice comfortable pool and a tremendous staff. I'll certainly be back again. Perfect, Perfect, Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN DALLAS!”
Reviews.Author: thechampions7108
Reviews.Content: We ended up choosing this place based on the reviews and the price, from hotels.com. We stayed for 3 nights. The staff was very friendly & helpful. The breakfast was very very delicious and the pool was amazing! The location of the place is ideal for anything downtown that you want to do. Samuel Garcia -- our waiter when we ate dinner there at the hotel was AMAZING. He made us feel like family. We tipped him very well because he was very friendly and very outstanding!! The bed is very comfortable and feels like your sleeping on a cloud, since we live about 2 hours from Dallas, we brought snacks and was VERY EXCITED to know that they had a little refridgerator in our hotel to keep our snacks cold! Everything about this hotel is 1000% amazing and I wouldn't choose anywhere else to stay! They do have complimentary shuttle but we didn't use it because everything that we did decide to do was very close and easy to get to. The Cleaning staff is awesome and they do a very good job. The only thing that I would have to say is that they do need more television channels in HD :D! but this is our hotel of choice everytime we visit the Dallas city from now on !!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry sir.”
Reviews.Author: KM-narf
Reviews.Content: I selected this property because of the reviews. Upon check-in, I was placed in a smoking room!!! Instant headache and the smell is STILL in my nose! By the way, I specifically reserved a non-smoking room via a fully prepaid reservation!!! They couldn't move me because the hotel was full! The next day, they moved me but to a room immediately next to the elevator! I asked to be moved again but...only smoking rooms are available. "I'm sorry sir."

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: myway_11
Reviews.Content: I request this hotel for every trip I make to Dallas. It's centrally located, the staff is very accommodating, great complimentary breakfast buffet and absolutely the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! Definitely a bargain for the location, freebies and amenities!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: arkansastraveler018
Reviews.Content: Being in the airline industry staying in hotels is a way of life. After 32 yrs of this there are certain things that I look for when I stay at a hotel. Pleasant staff, they don't have to be over the top friendly, just get me checked in with no hassle and be able to answer my questions. Rooms that are clean, not noisy, with comfortable beds and to me one of the most important things are the pillows. A pillow can determine a good nights rest or a miserable one for me. Acces to a computer and not required but anything free. MCM Elegante Hotel and Suites meets all these requirements and more. I don't like the computer, or maybe I should say it doesn't like me, but I have to use it for work. MCM Elegante provides computers. Did I say anything free? Free breakfast in the morning, and not a continental breakfast, but I full on breakfast buffet. And last but surely not least, free shuttle service to the airport. Without the free shuttle service it would cost me several dollars a month to use a cab to and from the airport. For me and I can only speak for myself, it is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: b737mdhou
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Elegante Hotel for several weeks on company business. I travel extensively around the country on company business and have stayed in many different hotels, but the hotel staff at the Elegante were extremely helpfull and courteous .Several Hotel vans were always available for pickup and drop off , They were prompt at airport pick up, and their rooms are very clean with the beds being as comfortable as any I have ever slept in. The only way my stay could have been any better is if there were a beach out the back door. I will definitely make the Elegante my hotel of choice when Im in Dallas .

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CJ611
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this place! I have stayed at the MCM Elegante in Abilene many times and was expecting the same type of service and rooms, I was very disappointed. The place is very outdated. The rooms are not all suites like the MCM Elegante in Abilene, so that was a let down as well. When checking in the gentleman took my payment and handed me a key, not telling me where we should park or even how to get to my room. I let that one go, because everyone has a bad day. After I asked where to park, etc., we went up to our room. As soon as you walk in you will see how much updating this property needs. The elevators have a musky smell and it doesn't get any better once in the room. There was no vent in the bathroom so when you shower that steam has nowhere to go but in your room for an instant sauna! Also our toilet wouldn't flush, but it was late and I did not want to change rooms so I lived with it. They do offer Bath and Body Works products in the bathroom and Starbucks coffee but I find it odd to make my coffee in the bathroom...and a little disgusting. There was a small fridge in the room but no microwave. Everyone I came in contact with at the hotel was rude! We wanted to get some water and a soda and we were told the vending machine on the first floor was broke and to use the one on the second floor. After walking the entire second floor we could not find a soda machine so we went back down to the front desk and the guy argue with us that it was up there yesterday so he doesn't understand where it is now...ummmm, well it's not there. So he said try to fourth floor, so back on the elevator and up to the 4th floor, I put my money in the machine and nothing, it took the dollar and gave me nothing in return. I returned to the desk and had to complete a form for a refund and just asked if I could get a bottle of water. He said go in there and pointed the the restaurant area. I entered and couldn't find anyone so went back toward the kitchen area and there was a gentleman cleaning up. I asked for a bottle of water and he gave me a warm bottle without saying a word. I was so tired and upset by then, I took a sip and put it in the fridge for the morning. Ridiculous. The beds are firm but I can say they have nice quality bedding and soft comfy pillows. Another warning, the walls are extremely thin. I could hear the ladies next door discussing that one has a thyroid problem at 5:30 in the morning. There is a full hot breakfast in the morning. But it was pretty gross, so I ate cold cereal. Again, the staff in the restaurant were rude and the only word I heard from them the whole time was, "where's your ticket." These people I guess assume that you have stayed there many times and know what to do. I had no clue where to give my ticket. The hotel in Abilene has someone that serves the breakfast for you, you dont open up the dishes and serve yourself, so that was different. This place needs a complete overhaul with the decor and staff! I will NOT stay there again! They do offer a special rate if going to the Presbyterian Hospital, but there are other places that are closer to the hospital with cheaper rates and friendlier staff. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds and BEST value in Dallas-True Texas Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Mike01890
Reviews.Content: At first, I have never heard of this brand, so I wasn't sure what to expect. Upon arrival, the first thing I noticed, besides the giant statue of an American eagle, was the warm and inviting atmosphere, and the incredible friendly front desk staff that actually greet you with a smile. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and have the MOST comfortable beds in Texas. I guarantee you will have a good night's sleep at this amazing, professional, clean, friendly, and hospitable establishment. These people have a committed passion for service, from the hotel's shuttle bus drivers to the bar tending staff (really good drink specials at their sports bar located inside the hotel). When I first returned to my room after a long day at work, not only was the room serviced as expected, but I could have sworn my own mother was just had been there! In the bathroom, the maids had laid out a face cloth on the counter and had placed my toiletries on there; which included my toothbrush, deodorant, aftershave, etc. which I thought was a very unique and charming touch. The restaurant located inside the hotel is very good and offers delicious cooked-to-order meals at very reasonable prices. The staff there is very pleasant as well... let me tell you, you'd swear you were at a five star resort, although I would rate this hotel five stars....I just want to end this by saying that these people have a genuine interest in their guests, and I will never stay anywhere else but the Elegante while I'm in the Dallas area. You will NOT be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: denton70
Reviews.Content: Affordable pricing & great staff, all in all this is a property that well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: benebs
Reviews.Content: The hotel room wasn't bad. It was a little outdated and the air conditioner was pretty noisy but got used to it. It was nice that it was so close to Love Field and plenty of restaurants. The drivers were very nice and good about getting you to and from the airport and to restaurants around the hotel. The thing that spoiled it was the front desk worker at the end of the trip. We had to be at the airport at 6:30am. So left the hotel 6:10am. After insisting that they would not open breakfast a minute or two early just to get a bagel and juice for the road (when the food was all sitting out and ready at that point), they ended up not even opening it for us before we had to leave for the airport when it was posted that it would open at 6am. He was very rude about the whole situation too. I definitely wouldn't think this is a four star hotel. Coworkers of mine had an earlier flight so they left the hotel at 5:30am. The hotel informed us the day before just to let them know when we want to be at the airport and they would drive us. The same gentleman that insisted we could not have breakfast, also told them that they can't drive them to the airport and that they would need to call a cab. It was pretty disappointing to be treated like that. I would say go to a different hotel if you want to be treated like a human.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value for Dallas”
Reviews.Author: hhsma
Reviews.Content: Close to freeways, restaurants. Deluxe breakfast. Comfortable beds and plush sheets. Very accommodating and friendly staff. Third stay at this Hotel and will be my Hotel of choice when visiting the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we gave it a try!!”
Reviews.Author: Dantony28
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were in desperate need of a staycation. We found the MCM Elegante on the web at an awesome special price and decided to give it a try. I was a little put off by some of the reviews but honestly, is it never easy to please EVERYONE. I was so impressed with this hotel and it's staff. Everyone form the bellmen to the General Manager was courteous and friendly. Although it is an older hotel, we could tell they had put in a lot of work into the hotel. The bed was soooo comfortable...we did not want to get up in the morning. The only reason we did was so that we would not miss out on the generous breakfast buffet. BEST thing about it was the cooked-to-order eggs. There were many other things we did not take advantage of though: the transportation to the airports, the Happy Hour and the fitness center. They also have an outdoor pool but it was too cold for swimming. Maybe next time we will give it a try...and there WILL most definitely be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mcwiggi
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very accomodating, the breakfast good, and the shuttle staff very kind. We plan on making this our place to stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “One Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: floraltouch
Reviews.Content: We go to Dallas twice a year, we found this hotel 3 years ago and we will never stay anywhere else. Free airport shuttle, free market shuttle, a great breakfast buffet, free happy hour and very reasonable rates If there is a problem the manager is right there to take care of it and for the most part the staff is very friendly highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “this is the place to stay when in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Lynnette59
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel that had a free shuttle to Love Field and this is the one I chose. The hotel was CLEAN, the staff was FRIENDLY, the room was spotless, the bed was sooo comfortable. This is the hotel I plan on staying at if and when I ever return to the Dallas area. The only thing I will suggest is a more friendly shuttle driver!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Mariska_76
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The GM was walking around greeting everyone, The staff was smiling and acted as if they truely loved their jobs. It was nice to stay at a hotel that was eager to help, ask how my stay was and if they needed to do anything to make my stay better. Wonderful beds, slept like a baby, and it was a safe atmosphere. Thanks So Much!! I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “How refreshing!”
Reviews.Author: frazier2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were treated like royalty. The rates are very reasonable, especially since you get free happy hour drinks at their bar and a full breakfast the next morning! If you go you must stop in at the bar and see "Bif". He will make your stay quite enjoyable. The manager "Perry" will greet you with open arms. When we go to Dallas in the future, this will definitely be our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: JeffRDallas
Reviews.Content: I travel the country continuously and stay in 5 star hotels across the nation, except when in Dallas, because I have found 5 star treatment at a 4 star hotel. The MCM Elegante is by far my favorite hotel to stay in. I have never recieved customer service to the likes of the MCM Elegante. The staff is genually concerned about your stay and are continuously checking to make sure you are happy and comfortable. How many hotels have you stayed in where the General Manager is actually there to greet you and insure that your stay is above expectation as you head out the door early in the morning? The MCM Elegante is the only hotel where I have had this experience. The rooms are beyond comfortable, the food is excellent, and the service uncomparable. I don't just highly recommend this hotel, I would not stay in any other in the Dallas area. Thanks, Jeff R.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great! Just stayed one...”
Reviews.Author: ChadInOKC
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Just stayed one night. It was right off the highway. Easy to find. Parking is good. Front counter staff was polite and friendly. The room was clean and totally adequate. The free breakfast was wonderful. Fresh fruit, french toast, Bacon, sausage, etc. Overall, I would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good except for the lizard”
Reviews.Author: dantelost
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice hotel minus the lizard that got into my wife's bag during the night that had her jumping around early in the morning. We went to go to Six Flags. It turned out to be pretty hot that day and after coming back to the hotel expecting a nice long hot shower it took at least five minutes for the water to get hot. It took just long enough for me to be convinced I wasn't getting a hot shower and for my blood pressure to shoot up. The breakfast was better than average and they kept putting food out all the way up until breakfast ended. The bar and restaurant were pretty good. The drinks weren't watered down and the food is reasonably priced. Be warned that there are a lot of strip clubs around this hotel, which can be a good or bad thing. I got the hotel at a pretty good discounted rate (around $70 a night). I would recommend it for the rate I got it for but not at full price. The hotel is nice but is definitely showing its age.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall deal in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: LoboTX
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay here since the first of this year, so I'm comfortable with writing a strong positive review. This hotel is the old Sheraton (which I also stayed at some years ago) and MCM has done a great job remodeling it. There are a few very minor signs of age but the hotel more than makes up for it. Staff is great and well trained. Rooms are clean, beds are first-class as are the other furnishings (flat-screen TV, microwave, large frig, granite counters, bath fixtures). They do all the small things well also - good coffee mugs, real glasses, Starbucks coffee in the room. Pool area is clean and very well landscaped. Hot breakfast is one of the best I've had in the US - bacon, sausage, great scrambled eggs, pastries, fresh fruit, berries, cereals, pancakes, yogurt, etc., and it's included. Great prices as well, as they'll match online prices. For those who want more space, the rooms around the pool are small suites (they call them cabanas). I've seen them and they're very nice and not much more ($20 more a night ?). I think they sleep 4+. Tonight I checked in and noticed the microwave was missing. I called the front desk to let them know (didn't want them to think I'd stolen it !) and they had a new one up here in five minutes, and replaced the TV remote when I mentioned it was weak. The two guys that came up were super friendly and wouldn't accept the offered tip. Excellent location right off I-35 and NW highway, good restaurants just a few blocks west. I'd give it five stars but I save that ranking for the Dorchester in London. I've stayed at a ton of hotels in Dallas and won't stay anywhere but here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: IanU63
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Elegante. Staff was very nice and friendly. Rooms were very clean. Comfy beds. I'd stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: violasdolls
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were here for a miniature show and found the hotel to be perfect for our needs. I especially appreciated the free breakfast and the free shuttle service. The room was also reasonably priced. I feel comfortable recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: cssct1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in serious need of some updates. The front desk employees do their job but are not friendly at all. The restaurant employees @ breakfast were very friendly and worked very hard to keep the buffet stocked. The rooms are small and our room was suppose to be non-smoking but smelled as if this was the first time it was used as non-smoking (ashtrays in the room). The floor when we first stepped off the elevator had some type of deoderizer smell that was so strong that you could actually taste it. The TV reception was awful. I would not recommend this hotel nor would I stay @ it again given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard the Older Reviews - We Took a Chance, and It Was NICE!”
Reviews.Author: bogiestl
Reviews.Content: My company provides continuing education for nurses, and we needed a Dallas venue, preferably centrally located and near DFW. Read the reviews, was put off at first, and then saw that it had had a change of ownership, and newer reviews weren't bad, and decided to take a chance. After all, how bad could a meeting room be? We were THRILLED! The hotel staff took great care of us, from guiding us around the traffic jam we experienced on I-35 coming in the night before, to ensuring that our meeting room was perfectly set up for the conference - no glitches. At all. None of the people attending the meeting had any problems either. The hotel rooms were VERY nice, and everything was clean, neat, and up to date. We've already booked for another session.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Outdated, Poor Food, Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: debialves
Reviews.Content: This 4-Star only deserves 1/2 Star in my opinion. My room was shabby, there was the burn mark of an iron on the carpet, the bottom drawer of my very small dresser was about to fall apart, the tv control was worn out, the handle fell off the hot water faucet on the sink, there are no dead bolts on the doors, the bathroom floor wasn't cleaned behind the door, and the final insult was the ice machine sitting in the hall right outside my door in the hallway...it woke me up regularly at 4 am each morning of my stay. I've never stayed in a hotel where the ice machine was sitting in an open hallway until now. The restaurant was dark and dingy, and the food was barely adequate, very mediocre. The one bright spot was the bar, which was spacious and lively, the service was great, and I had one of the best Bloody Mary's I've ever drank.

Reviews.Title: “Not very elegante!”
Reviews.Author: mwansley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a layover through Dallas. Got a decent (not great) rate. The GOOD: 1. Nice upscale look inside room. 2. Starbucks coffee in room 3. Bach & Body Works products. The BAD: 1. Hotel not listed under curtesy phone at airport. 2. Shuttle took 35min to pick me up 3. At least 20min to the airport. 4. Advertised "free" internet is not. 5. Only one TV worked, One phone worked. 6. Pool Cabana Suite sucks, feels like a motel not a hotel. Overall this place was more like a 2 star, not a three. Would not reccomend. Stick with a national chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: sglewis60
Reviews.Content: The airconditioning broke during the night, because we did not notify immediately, we received not discount. Low quality rooms. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Upset guest!”
Reviews.Author: KilleenIslandgirl
Reviews.Content: Being close to the highway you would think nothing bad would happen. Our car was broken into, the security guard is suppose to be doing his job watching the hotel outside and in, he was talking to the people who work in the front checking in quest! Our first time in Dallas and this is what happens. There won't be a next time for us here in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDre
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I are extremely disappointed in this hotel. First of all, we went the same weekend as a Dallas Cowboy football game and were surprised that it was not staffed properly for that weekend. There was a very long wait to check-in to our room, and the front desk was very crowded and disorganized. The bar was a crazy mess, completely disorganized and dysfunctional there was a 20 minute wait for drink, we did take into mind that it was a game weekend but still no excuse. Second, when we called the hotel several weeks prior to check-in, the hotel staff told us that they had a free shuttle to and from Texas Stadium (which is one of the reason why we booked). When we got to the hotel they alerted us that it would be $12 per person for the shuttle to and from the stadium (cheaper to take a cab). To top it off, there was construction going on at the hotel and we woke up in the morning to the sounds of hammering and drills. With no warning!! And most importantly, on the day that we left the hotel, we had the hotel bell desk hold our luggage so that we could get some breakfast before heading to the airport. When we got back to the hotel to get our luggage, the staff had sent our luggage with someone else to the airport. Talk about a shocker, I got so nervous thinking we would never see our suitcase with the contents again. However, they retuned the luggage after about 30 minutes. But with no remorse, not even a simply â€œsorry, our mistakeâ€�! The shuttle driver that drove us to the airport was more apologetic then the manager who told us about our missing luggage. Too bad, the hotel itself was nice enough for us to stay again but this experience and the hotel staff and the way they function completely ruined it for us.

Reviews.Title: “More bad than good”
Reviews.Author: lalotp
Reviews.Content: Check in was great. Shuttle service is great except on weekends when they ususally have college teams stay here and then al lthe attention goes to groups and not family nor individual travelers. There is availability of adult programming on the TVs, but don't weaste your money. The walls are very thin so you can hear EVERYTHING!!!! I mean, you can almost see the couple in the next room "doing it." Man, something really wild was going on, I thnk I even heard a dog bark... It can be very entertaining. :) In the AM... (Let me tell you that I am a sound sleeper) Even though I was very tired, I could not sleep past 7AM. Noise coming in form everywjhere...people leaving, doors slamming, vacuum cleaners and people talking. It was unbelievably clear as if they all were next to my bed. Ac in the room is very noisy... I think the same is in all rooms. You set the ac to your desired temp, but about every 15 minutes it will run into gear loudly for 5 minutes... Then you will have that 4 times per hour throughout the night. It should be fine if you are not going to be in the room that much or you don't plan to sleep at all. :) Good things: Coffe makerHOUSEKEEPING IS SUPERB!!! NICE PEOPLE AND VERY ATTENTIVE. great soap, work desk and fridge in room, comfortable beds, shuttle services Mon-Thursday. Not much to do around the hotel unless you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: FL_Traveler_2007
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was to go to the Dallas Cowboys game (Vs. Eagles, Monday night game)... Pros: - Free shuttle service to/from airport, free shuttle anywhere within 5-mile radius is free - bed & pillows were comfortable - free happy hour from 5PM - 6:30PM - free breakfast buffet (good variety) - bathroom goodies are from Bath & Body works (smell good) - clean hotel overall - friendly staff - enjoyable experience Cons: - A/C is very loud, its a unit next to the window it goes on and off every few seconds, its annoying - there's not much to do in the area, only chain restaurants, 1 nudity bar and couple clubs that look pretty boring If we were to go back, we would most likely stay for 1 night meaning fly in, go to the game, sleep at hotel and fly out next morning back home. We went "Downtown" where the aquarium is located, not much there, reataurants and a couple stores. The shuttle also took us to World Trade center although since we are not vendors we can't shop there, its only for vendors and you buy things in bulk. Perhaps since we didn't have our own car we didn't get to see/do much, maybe that would have made a difference, I can't believe that there is not much to do in Dallas, its a big town..Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Being renovated; not horrible”
Reviews.Author: Foovius
Reviews.Content: You can probably discount the really negative reviews from 2007, as the Elegante is under new management and is being renovated in mid-2008. The hotel isn't great, but it's not terrible either. The A/Cs are on the wall, not central, so they're rather loud, but the rooms are clean, with good free Internet (about 1700 kbps, not fast, but faster than most U.S. hotels I've been in lately). Clean, carpet, decent decor, small refrigerator and microwave oven. Clean, new bedding and reasonably comfortable beds. This part of Dallas is full of cheap chain restaurants. Not pretty, but convenient to DFW if, like me, you're stuck in bad weather (summer lightning thunderstorms) and having to spend an extra unplanned night in Dallas. The hotel was good about sending shuttles to DFW to pick up folks, and scheduling them back to the airport the next day for another try at getting the heck out of town. There are many, many better hotels in Dallas, but I'd say this one is better than 'average' if you consider the full range of places people could stay. Pool (which I haven't seen yet) is only open until 11 (though that's typical). Weight room is open all night. Food closes at 10, I believe, though there are lots of places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “There's better places to stay in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: bbade514
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long business trip. First I will say that the staff was very friendly. I was picked up at DFW in a reasonable time and check in went smooth. The room itself was clean and the bed was comfortable, but that was about it. The property is in need of an update. The building is a drab brown color and the hallway floor outside of my room was very dirty as the carpet had not been cleaned in some time and was beginning to pull up. The ice machines did not work on at least 3 of the floors. The outdoor pool was a mess. There was some sand in the pool from the construction on the property. Their way of cleaning the sand was taking a squeegee and sweeping down the pool stairs to the bottom of the pool and leaving it there. I am not kidding as I watched this from my room. Most of the pool chairs were broken and several tiles from inside of the pool were missing. All in all, I would not be back to this property. There are so many more places to stay in Dallas, why spend your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Texasjambono1
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from Scotland we had the pleasure of staying at the Elegante. The staff were first class & the room spotless, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We read previous reviews before we left, which gave us concern but these proved to be completely unfounded.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: Lt-49
Reviews.Content: I have never received service like I received at the Elegante during my four night stay. The staff bent over backwards to ensure that I had everything that I needed. We were in the lobby on our way to dinner and were trying to figure out how to get to the restaurant. An employee saw us struggling with directions and took us to the computer where he printed out the route. He advised us of construction and gave a way to avoid it. I noticed that he wasn't dressed like the rest of the staff and asked what he did at the hotel...he was one of the MAINTENANCE workers. I stayed at the Omni two weeks before and couldn't get anyone at the front desk to help. The MCM is an average hotel, clean, quiet with nice rooms. The area was a bit concerning, but I would definitely stay at the hotel again, for the staff alone.

Reviews.Title: “A Whole Lot of Other Choices in the Area”
Reviews.Author: stainged04
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the location was going to be very convenient to the event I was attending. I really should have checked Trip Advisor first. This place is bad. Stay away! I am normally a pretty easy-going traveler. Read my other reviews. However, this hotel disappointed in almost every way. The front desk staff was rude and unhelpful. The room was in very poor condition. The door lock looked like a last minute improvisation. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable that I have ever experienced. The grounds of the hotel were in disrepair. The highlights of my stay were that I was only there for one night, and my car was still in the parking lot in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fflyer90
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've stayed ever! A disgrace to the Radisson Hotel Chain, the room was filthy and smelled terrible. I was afraid to let my child walk barefoot on the carpet, spots everywhere, yuck! Same goes for the pool; and cannot comment on the breakfast because I would not eat there for a million dollars. To be sincere, the only good thing there is the front desk manager (Don) who acts very professional and deserves to work at a better place.

Reviews.Title: “kept the luggage. lost the room”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 separate rooms, for 2 nights each, with written confirmations. After landing, we picked up our rental car, and stopped at the hotel to drop off our bags. Our rooms weren't ready, but they gladly stored our bags. We went to our trade show, then to dinner, and got back to the hotel at 9:40pm. They still had our bags, but had given away our rooms. They "walked" us, to another hotel owned by the same company, but 20 minutes further away...and not as nice. The folks behind the desk continued to check in others, as we were being sent away. We were told that the manager only works 8-5, and that there was no one in the hotel who could help us.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs an update badly. The pool was kinda green and not very inviting. Electrical outlets in the room were broken. Carpeting in the room looked dirty to the point you didn't want to take your shoes off. Iron didn't work and was replaced with another non-working model. Breakfast in the hotel dining room is an OK self-serve experience (eggs made to order). This was a bargain rate compared to other hotels, but you definately get what you paid for. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: hoosierdaddy
Reviews.Content: We chose the Radisson for our 19th anniversary getaway because the rates seemed reasonable for the accommodations. When we vacation, we don't spend a lot of time in our room but want it to be very neat and clean. We went into this past weekend, based on Tripadvisor reviews, knowing that the Radisson was in the final phases of a major remodel, which is basically what we found. We reserved a room with a sleep number king bed, which my wife tried and enjoyed, and ended up in a suite rather than a regular room which was a nice surprise. There were obvious signs of a remodel in progress; missing baseboards in the hallway and in our room, hallway temperatures on the sixth floor around 95 degrees due to a missing thru-the-wall a/c unit, minor problems w/one of the a/cunits in our room, and an under the-counter-fridge in our room which we defrosted ourselves to get it to work properly. Having been in the construction industry for over 30 years, my guess is that the work that has been done was done in-house rather than by a professional contractor. On the positive side, the front desk and staff were very polite and responsive to our requests for maintenance and very helpful to us in finding our way around town. Would we stay there again knowing what we know now? Sure. At $70 per night for a suite w/a king bed, the Radisson was acceptable though not impressive. We found nothing gross or disgusting but rather a well-trained staff trying to make up for the obvious inconvenience of a remodel in progress. We also found a watch by the pool Sunday that we would really like to return to its rightful owner. My message today left w/housekeeping, who is in charge of lost and found, has not been acknowledged yet. cakesetmoi

Reviews.Title: “Dallas Dump Desiring a Dress-Up”
Reviews.Author: rcase
Reviews.Content: To put it plain and simple.......this is not one of the greatest hotels in Dallas. In fact, we were pretty disappointed. Being on Northwest Highway, this hotel has great potential. Prime location, close to lots of entertainment and dining options, virtually no competition with any hotels around. However, the Radisson has not yet taken advantage of its opportunities. When we arrived, we were told we would be staying in a pool side suite with a kitchenette and separate living space. Sounds Great, huh!!! Forget it. The room itself was nicely decorated, but the A/C did not work, the room smelt of stagnant cigarette smoke, and the outside looked like a run down trash motel. In fact, they have two areas for rooms. One is within the main building!!! ASK FOR THESE ROOMS. The others rooms are separated to the outdoors like an older motel. Only about 1/4 of these rooms were renovated, so tons of these rooms were trashed out. In fact, this specific area was accessable to anyone who wanted to walk through an unlocked, opened fence. We called the front desk to complain about the A/C. They said someone would be up to fix it. An hour later, and still 90 degrees in the room, we went to the front desk and requested a new room on the inside of the building. They were very polite and quickly found us a new room on the 4th floor. I have no complaints about the staff. They were fine. Upon arrival to the 4th floor, we realized that one of the rooms had apparently sprung a leak. There was standing water in the hallway! NICE!!! We went in our room. It was cold, newly remodeled, and had a comfy bed. Despite the water, we opted to stay. We both slept very well. No complaints there. Basically, this hotel is undergoing major renovation, however, they don't seem to understand that guests don't want to be a forward participant in the dirty side of renovation. In my opinion, if you are thinking about staying here to save $20, just spend the extra $20 on a better hotel. Sorry Radisson, you failed. We will most definately never stay here again!!! HAPPY TRAVELS!!!

Reviews.Title: “texas hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3- 11-05 to 3-13-05 and had a great time. The hotel is 12 min from downtown. The hotel has a free shuttle service from both DFW airport and Love Field which was really nice so we didnt have to rent a car. The price of the hotel was cheap $52 a night through hotels. The hotel itself is nice and clean. The rooms were decorated nicely. and clean. The hotel staff kept checking to make sure our stay was satisfactory and made themselves available if we needed them. The hotel is right by restaurant row and a movie theatre. The shuttle drivers take you to the restaurant of your choice (Joes crab shack, chilis, red lobster, humperdinks, pappa deux seafood etc...) That was nice. I would recommend tipping the drivers $1 -2 as a courtesy. The shuttle drivers will go out of their way to get you where you want to go, they are friendly and helpful with tourist type questions. I would recommend going to down town and going to the JFK museum at the book depository building in the west end market. It costs about $8 (with coupon from hotel) per person. It was very interesting to see such history, to be there. I am in my early thirties so I wasnt even around during this time, but I can only imagine and to see the footage from that day gave me goose bumps. It was interesting to learn the history behind it all. I some how thought the "grassy knoll" would have been bigger. Beware of scammers down by there trying to get you to buy a tour, dont do it. Take the day and walk around down town and the market, it was cool. My husband and I walked from the Book Depository building up two blocks to Ross st and then all the way down ross to Aknard (just past the Fairmont hotel) to the M LINE Trolley (which is free) and we rhode the Trolley to the Hard Rock Cafe (on mckinney st) this is the place to be there are nice shops. We also got back on the trolley going down mckinney to the Westend village (this is the place to do shopping it is a very nice area with nice exspensive shops and cute out of the way restaurants ) it is in the Turtle Creek area where a lot of wealthy people live. Very Quaint. We had a great time and the hotel although isnt in downtown, did everything a hotel should do, they took care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! We went for the OU/Texas game and what a great location. The staff was friendly and the food was great. The place is under new management and the place was fantastic. The new owners have put a lot of money into fixing up the place and will continue their remodeling of all the rooms in the next 6 months. We stayed in one of their suites and it was great. If you're looking for a place close to Dallas/Love Field, this is your place!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a three night stay here on Expedia. The rates were good and this hotel was conveniently located. First impression was that the lobby was a little run down, then it got worse. The lamp shades on the bedside lamps were broken. The control for the hot/cold water on the tub was falling off and there was no hot water in the tub that evening. The next morning, still no hot water in the tub. Called maintenance. They worked on my bathroom for a while and then I had 1 minute of hot water. That evening I changed rooms. Also had broken lamp shades and no hot water. Changed rooms again. The third night the restaurant had no hot food because there was a gas leak in the kitchen. Also, no hot water. They had to jack-hammer the cement floor to repair the gas line and the entire hotel shook. At midnight I had had enough. I had to pack up and move to another hotel.
